column4: Free firmware<ref group="note" name="free firmware">'N/A' means firmware is stored in device at all times  'yes' means firmware is available for totally free redistribution  'no' means you have to get into non-free-software contract with the manufacturer to get access to the firmware</ref>
column8: Free software<ref group=note name="'free software'">in terms of no binary-only requirements that are posed by the driver  i.e. you can modify all code that is run on your CPU</ref>

column2: Atheros AR5008 up to the AR9287
Realtek RTL8188CUS  RTL8188CE-VAU  RTL8188EUS  RTL8188RU  and RTL8192CU
